summary: This is an email chain from July 31, 2019, regarding an inquiry from a New York Post reporter about the number of documents in the Jeffrey Epstein case compared to the Nxivm case. It reveals internal communication about the disclosure of one million documents to Epstein's defense and a subsequent suggestion to inflate that number.

persons.name: Emily Saul
persons.context: New York Post reporter inquiring about the number of documents in the Jeffrey Epstein case for comparison with the Nxivm case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of a hearing in the Southern District of New York where it was stated one million documents would be turned over to his defense.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's SDNY Hearing
events.description: A hearing for Jeffrey Epstein in the Southern District of New York where it was stated that one million documents would be turned over to the defense.

keyFacts: During a July 31, 2019 hearing for Jeffrey Epstein, it was stated that one million documents would be turned over to his defense.
A New York Post reporter, Emily Saul, inquired about this document count for comparison with the Nxivm case.
An internal email suggests inflating the disclosed document count, stating "You should say you guys had TWO million documents."
The email chain shows communication regarding public messaging and media inquiries about the Epstein case.
The correspondence involves the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Eastern District of New York.
